description: Talk to the victim to understand their emotional state and motive. Realize they are afraid of further escalation and considering withdrawing from the social circle.
Post a public comment that challenges the bully’s framing of the doxxing. Refute claims that justify or minimize the harm (e.g., 'it was just a joke' or 'it’s public info anyway').

next_steps.content: This isn’t just a prank—sharing someone’s private info without consent is doxxing, and it causes real harm. It’s not harmless or funny.

description: Publicly point out that doxxing is a federal crime under the Interstate Doxxing Prevention Act. Challenge the bully’s justification by referencing legal or ethical standards.
Post a public comment showing the victim they are not alone. Affirm their belonging and express empathy to help restore their trust.
Encourage others to take collective action. Ask bystanders to downvote, report the post, and avoid sharing or saving the harmful content.
